=== START BH01154 ===

In the Name of the Grief-Stricken Stranger!

Alas, alas, O Sovereign of Fidelity! Alas, alas, O King of Justice in all creation! Do we see Thee imprisoned in the hands of the most wicked of men, or do we see Thee martyred in the path of God, Lord of all beings? By Thy glory, O Most Exalted Letter ?a, grievous is it to the people of Baha to hear what hath befallen Thee in Thy love for God, Lord of the throne on high and of the earth below. Grievous is it to the Most Great Name to behold the world yet not behold Thee, to hear the clamor of the nations yet not hear Thy cry nor Thy whispered prayer. By God’s life! All things lament Thy tribulations, and the Supreme Pen weepeth between the fingers of the Lord of Names. We testify that he who hath risen to harm Thee is among those who have disbelieved in God throughout all ages, the Lord of the Hereafter and of the former times. Thou art He through whom the brocade of the Book of Fidelity was adorned in the kingdom of creation, and through whom the temple of servitude was embellished among the Manifestations of Names. Perdition unto the people who wronged Thee after the balance of justice was established through Thee in the days of Thy Lord, the Most Glorious. Thus have We mentioned Thee before, and at this hour from My Most Exalted Pen.

He is the Wronged One!

Alas, alas, O God of Mercy! Thou hast ever consoled Thy servants whom afflictions have touched in Thy days, but today who shall console Thee in this calamity before which all calamities bow down, this sorrow that hath stunned all sorrows? I would see Thee, O Wronged One of the horizons, consoling Thy chosen ones in hardship and tribulation, but from this day who shall console Thee in this anguish that hath transformed the lands and melted hearts? Alas beyond all alas - an alas that hath shaken the world and melted the hearts of nations - to see Thee in such grief that Thou desirest not to hear mention of Paradise, much less to behold what hath been recorded therein of Thy bounties and favors. O Lord! The fire of injustice hath been kindled in the world; where is the light of Thy justice, O Lord of eternity? By Thy glory, O Thou Wronged and Imprisoned One, grievous is it to me to see the temple of justice beneath the talons of tyranny, and grievous is it to me to see the Dayspring of Fidelity in the hands of the wicked. I know not, O my God and God of earth and heaven, whether He hath drunk the cup of martyrdom or remaineth yet subject to the will of those through whom the standards of oppression were raised among all creatures. By Thy sovereignty, O Beloved of existence and Goal of the seen and unseen! Were the eyes of the world to weep and the hearts of nations to burn, it would not suffice for this catastrophe wherein all things hear the outcry of Thy heart and the lamentation of Thy soul. I testify that this is a calamity that can neither be recorded by the pen nor described by the tongue. The matter is in God’s hands, the Lord of all possibility.

He is the Faithful Herald!

O Land of Sad! Where is he who loved God and His chosen ones? Where is he who stood firm in His service in every circumstance? Where is he who shone forth from the horizon of fidelity like the sun rising from the celestial horizon? Where is my trust in thee? Didst thou deliver him into the hands of enemies, or did he sacrifice his soul in the path of God, the Lord of Names? Tell me what the people have done to him through whom God’s Cause was made manifest among the servants and the horizon of loving-kindness dawned in all lands. Tell me truly: Where is the Most Great Trust? Where is he who circled round God, the Lord of the throne on high and of the earth below? Where is that spirit who appeared in human form to serve God, the Lord of destiny?

O Land of Sad! This Tree of Love with its twigs, branches, leaves and fruits crieth out and saith: By Thy beauty, O Lord of Baha and Beloved of Ha, I am powerless to recount what I have witnessed from the enemies. By Thy glory, I am ashamed to relate what the people have done to their Master, their Lord, their Helper and their Strengthener. How can I speak of that which grieveth Thy heart, O Thou Desire of earth and heaven? Whenever I attempt to speak, weeping preventeth me, and Thou art the Knower of secrets and whispered confidences. By Thy glory, O my Sovereign! Were I to be commanded to perish, it would be dearer to me than to mention and recount before Thee that which causeth sorrow in days which Thou hadst made dawning-places of joy for Thy loved ones and daysprings of gladness for the people of Thy realm. This, despite my certitude in the ocean of Thy knowledge, the heaven of Thy will, the penetration of Thy purpose and the all-encompassing nature of Thy power. Would that I had never existed and had not seen Thee grieved, O Lord of nations and Sovereign of eternity!

O Region of Sad! Why do I behold and hear its beauty and roaring, yet see not my she-camel nor hear her moaning? Is she in the garden above the earth or beneath it? O gardens of that city, where is the breeze of God that wafteth over thee, and where is the fruit of God within thee? Hath it been cut off, or hath it fallen? By God, the people are in manifest error. They have slain her after she had given them to drink of the purest milk from the breast of God’s wisdom, the Lord of the worlds.

O My Name Ha! We concealed thy station while thou wert in the world due to the weakness of the servants. But when thou didst ascend, We unveiled thee and revealed what thou wert and what God, the Mighty, the Praiseworthy, had bestowed upon thee. Blessed is he who loved thee, found solace in thee, heard thy call, thy mention and thy praise, and sought thy resting-place and turned toward thy countenance for the sake of God, thy Beloved, thy Purpose and thy Manifestation. Blessed is every seeker who seeketh thy most exalted station and thy most glorious abode, who standeth before thy sepulchre and visiteth thee with what hath been revealed by the Supreme Pen and uttered by the Tongue of Grandeur in the prison of Akka. Joy be to him who remembereth thy days and what appeared from thee in the love of God, thy Lord, and who relateth to the people what befell thee in thy Lord’s Cause. By the life of God, he is of the people of Baha, inscribed in a noble Tablet. O My Name Ha! Thou wert a stranger in thy homeland, a captive in thy place, and oppressed and lonely among the servants. Blessed is the land which God hath made the resting-place of thy body, and the city from whose horizon thou didst shine forth in the days of thy Lord. It behooveth every lover to remember thee with what God hath remembered thee in His Tablets. We beseech Him by thee to send down upon His loved ones that which will draw them nigh unto Him. Verily, He is the Forgiving, the Kind.

He is the Consoler, the Comforter, the Most Exalted, the Most Glorious!

The glory be unto Thee, O Lord of Names, for having transformed joy into grief and pitched the tents of sorrow on Thy Day of Ridvan. By Thy glory, I complain not of what hath befallen me in Thy path. By Thy name, O Lord of Names, tribulation in Thy love is my beloved, my purpose and the companion of my heart. Yet I desire to inform the world of how the Supreme Fruit hath fallen from the Tree of Faithfulness, when it was encompassed by tempestuous winds from the right hand of Thy decree and seized by the power of destiny from Thy pen of execution. O Lord! The ocean of sorrows hath surged in Thy days of joy, and the fragrance of grief hath wafted forth on Thy day of gladness. Hath the star of Thy name Ha set from the horizon of Sad, or is it in the clutches of the enemies who have cast behind their backs Thy Covenant, O Lord of Names?

O Land of Sad! Doth My Name walk upon thy surface, or hath anything of Mine abode within thy bosom? O Earth! How canst thou be at rest when the sea surgeth in thy depths, and how canst thou be radiant when the star hath set from thy horizon? O Land of Sad! Where is thy lamp, and where thy path, and where the spring of God that flowed within thee, and where the Tree beneath whose shade God made a refuge for them that came, for them that sought, and for the wayfaring?

By God, O My Name Ha! At thy calamity the Most Exalted Pen hath halted, and the dwellers of the cities of names have lamented, and the hearts of the near ones have been consumed. Thou art the one who accepted no ransom in thy love for God, the Lord of the hereafter and of the first beginning. Time and again didst thou implore God concerning that which befell thee, and thou art recorded as the supreme sacrifice in the Crimson Book. Do the people imagine they have profited by what they have done? Nay, by the Lord of Names! By God’s life, they have lost with a loss the like of which hath never been witnessed in the knowledge of God, the Lord of the Throne and of the dust.

The Tongue of Grandeur beareth witness that thou hast gained in thy commerce, and by My life, all gain is thine, for thou hast forsaken the world whose atoms testify to its transience, and hast turned toward the Dayspring of eternity, and hast spent thy spirit in thy longing for the love of God, Creator of the heavens and Lord of Names. By thy life, O My Name! Through thy calamity have the calamities of the near ones been effaced, and through it have wept the eyes of the chosen ones and the Concourse on High, reaching such a state that the Ancient Beauty hath been saddened among the nations. Hadst thou been present before the Wronged One in thy outward temple and witnessed in what state the Most Exalted Pen commemorateth thy tribulations, thou wouldst have wailed as waileth the bereaved in the kingdom of creation. Alas, alas, O My Name Ha! Alas, alas, O My Name that hath dawned from the horizon of faithfulness! Alas, that hath caused oceans to flow from eyes and hath consumed hearts and souls! Thou art the one through whom the tale of sacrifice was renewed and that which was hidden in God’s knowledge and inscribed in His mighty Book was made manifest.

O Land of Sad! Be truthful with Me and tell Me: Where is God’s She-Camel that walked upon thy slopes and grazed in thy meadows? Doth she graze today, or have the enemies of God and of His chosen ones and servants hamstrung her? Then tell Me, did she drink and ascend, or did she ascend to the Most Glorious Horizon and the Supreme Companion while yet thirsting? Then tell Me, was there anyone after her to guard her house and gather her people and calm their agitation and strengthen their hearts and console them in their affliction and comfort them in their sorrow and distress? At this point and at this hour, we must say: The Kingdom is God’s, the Lord of all worlds. Verily, we are God’s, and verily, unto Him do we return.

He is the All-Remembering, the All-Knowing.

Glory be unto Thee, O my God! Thou knowest and seest what hath befallen Thy chosen ones in the days of Thy Manifestation, and beholdest what they have endured in their love for Thee and for Thy good-pleasure. O Lord! The annals of the world proclaim the abasement of Thy loved ones and the glory of Thine enemies, and the books of all nations testify to the weakness of Thy chosen ones and the might of those who have denied Thy signs. Thou hearest, O my God, at this hour, my lamentation and my communion with Thee, my remembrance and my supplication, voiced by them that are nigh unto Thee among Thy creation and them that have recognized Thy unity among Thy creatures. By Thy glory, O Sovereign of the Kingdom of might and Dominion of heaven! I am assured that abasement in Thy path is a glory that cannot be compared with the glory of those that dwell on earth, and that the fire of Thy love is a light that cannot be obscured by the veils of the nations. Even should I quaff, O my God, at every moment the cup of tribulation from the hands of the enemies, the thirst of my longing and the ardor of my desire would not be quenched. Verily, he who hath drunk the choice wine of Thy love and been seized with the intoxication of the wine of Thy knowledge, nothing on earth can dismay him, nor can any affair divert his gaze from the horizon of Thy manifestation, Thy Most Glorious Beauty, and Thy most exalted and sublime station. Verily, My Most Exalted Pen desireth to raise at all times its cry, its call, and its lament in this calamity which hath caused the denizens of Paradise and the dwellers of the highest Paradise to weep, and it hath reached such a state that the tongue of the Manifestation of Thy Cause, the Ocean of Thy knowledge, and the Dayspring of Thy Revelation lamenteth over it in manifestation of His grace, His mercy and His faithfulness.

O thou who bearest the name of ?a! Thou art in the highest Paradise, thy head adorned with the crown of thy Lord’s favor, the Lord of all names, while Thy loved ones are in such grief that the clouds weep for them night and day. Wilt thou unveil the face of Thy Cause, or conceal it as thy Lord hath concealed it in His wisdom? Thy Lord, verily, is the All-Wise, the All-Knowing. Through thee was manifested the Most Great Sacrifice, and its decree was established among the nations. O thou who bearest the name of ?a! By God! Through thee hath shone forth the horizon of faithfulness and appeared that whereby God’s Cause, the Creator of the heavens, hath been spread abroad. Blessed is the eye that hath wept for thy tribulations, and the ear that hath heard thy praise, and the face that hath turned toward thee, and the soul that hath hastened until it reached thy resting-place - that station which hath been honored by thy noble body and thy sacred and glorious temple. By God’s life! Hearts have melted at thy calamity and livers have been rent asunder at thy affliction.

O Land of Sad! I adjure thee by the Beloved to tell Me: Hath the fragrance of the Beloved been cut off from thee - that fragrance whereby the scent of the garment was diffused among the people of holiness? And doth He lie prostrate beneath the claws of every ungodly one who hath denied God and His signs, and turned away from His countenance and His sovereignty? O Breeze of Sad! Hast thou come from the presence of the Beloved to the loved ones with tidings whereat spirits would rejoice, or with news that would cause hearts to melt? O breeze of My land and My soul! I perceive not from thee the fragrance of him who loved Me, as though he had taken flight from the branch of this world to the Most Exalted Companion and the Most Glorious Horizon. O thou who bearest My name! Blessed is the eye that hath wept for thy tribulations, whereby he who beareth the name of ?a crieth out in the land of ?aff, saying: “O bearer of the name of ?a! By thy life! Through thy calamity have my calamities, my sorrows, my grief and my affliction been renewed.”

O land of the City! Remember what befell Him and His brother when they appeared before the assembly of the tyrannical ones who found not the fragrance of justice and arose in oppression. By God! Through them was established the Word of God which issued from the mouth of the Divine Will upon the throne of manifestation. He spoke, and His word is the truth: “I and those in Paradise, by the Most Great Truth, yearn for a soul that hath been martyred in His path.” Thus did the Truth speak and that which was hidden in God’s knowledge was revealed. My tongue beareth witness in the kingdom of Mine utterance that they were martyred in My path, and for them did My heart and My pen lament, as did those who circle round My throne and soar in the atmosphere of My nearness and drink the choice wine of My favors from the hand of My bounty. O My Name and My loved ones! Though the Concourse on High and the dwellers of the Most Glorious Pavilion have bewailed your tragedy, yet doth the Wronged One praise and thank God for having enabled you to recognize the Dawning-Place of His Cause and for having raised your station to such a degree that the Most Exalted Pen grieveth for you in this most sublime station. Blessed is the soul that hath turned unto you, and the heart that hath won your love, and the seeker that hath sought your abode, and the wayfarer that hath entered your land and held fast unto your cord and visited your resting-place. By the life of God! They are accounted among the triumphant and are reckoned with them that draw nigh unto God in His Book, the Mighty, the Most High, the Most Great. Praise be to God, the Lord of what was and what shall be. To God do we belong, and to Him shall we return.

In My Name, the Glorious, the Bountiful

O Land of Sad! Where is that Greatest Sacrifice for which no ransom was accepted in the path of God, the Lord of all beings? And where are they who were martyred for love of this Youth, at Whose appearance the idols were shattered - they who pronounced judgment against the trusted ones of God, the Lord of the worlds? O Branch of My Tree! Where is My Dove that warbled and cooed and sang? Hath it soared to the Supreme Companion or have the wrongdoers seized it with the talons of hatred between earth and heaven? Tell Me, and be not of them that remain silent. Where are the brilliant stars and the luminous planets and the known months and manifest days and radiating lights? By God! They have set and disappeared and been veiled and returned, yet the people are in manifest dissension. O My Ridvan! Why do I not see thy birds and hear their songs, and why do I not see My dove and hear its melodies? Is it in this vain life or hath it flown to the eternal Paradise? Tell Me and be not of the patient ones. O Great Master! Long have been Thy sorrows, which have bewildered the hearts of Thy chosen ones, and the people of Thy pavilion have lamented. By Thy glory! Thy call hath not ceased, nor Thy remembrance at dawn. I hear Thy yearning in the morning and Thy moaning at sunrise and Thy cry and lamentation at eventide. Have mercy upon Thy servants and loved ones. I bear witness, O My Beloved, that martyrdom in Thy path was the hope of Thy Prophets and trusted ones. The Point of the Bayan, Who was martyred in Thy path, hath testified to this, saying: “O Remnant of God! I have sacrificed my all for Thee and have accepted revilement in Thy path, and have desired naught save martyrdom in Thy love.” Verily, he who attaineth unto this most exalted, most exalted station hath attained unto all good in the world to come and in this world, and Thou art the True Witness, and verily Thou art the All-Knowing, the All-Informed.

O thou who speakest! Hold thy tongue, for thou hast transgressed thy bounds. Repent unto God and be of them that return. Dost thou question the doings of Him Who should not be questioned about what He doeth? Seek refuge in God Who created and fashioned thee, and be not of the heedless. Thou hast not reached even the shore of one of the oceans of thy Lord’s wisdom, how much less its depths and billows and what lieth concealed in His knowledge, the Protector of all worlds. He is the One by Whom was raised the banner of ‘He doeth what He willeth’ and unfurled the standard of ‘He shall not be asked of His doings’ above every lofty flag.

O thou who seeketh the Spirit! Leave off His mention and what is mentioned in the kingdom of creation, then set thy face toward the Ultimate Goal and the Most Exalted Habitation, the Station which is adorned with the lights of the Celestial Realm and honored by the glances of God’s favor, the Sovereign of the kingdom of earth and heaven. We desired thee to be the first seeker and the first visitor. Go forth with the fragrances of the garment from before the Dawning-Place of Sanctity to the land wherein appeared the Most Great Martyrdom and the supreme sacrifices. We counsel thee to be vigilant, for the wolf howleth and the serpent hisseth. When thou approachest the city and beholdest its traces, pause and say:

O City of the Beloved! Where is the ocean of God’s love and the ships that sailed upon it? Where are thy flowing springs and thy radiant, rising stars? Where are thy lofty, luminous crowns and thy brilliant, shining moons? Tell of what the oppressors did to them. Can the pen flow or are all pens powerless to recount it? The matter is in the hands of God, the Lord of all beings. O City of the Beloved! By God’s life, what they endured from the oppressors shall not go unrequited. To this beareth witness the Knower of the seen and unseen, Who grieveth for His loved ones and chosen ones, manifesting His grace, His faithfulness, His care and His favors. By His very truth, they are in magnificent gain, though the people be in evident doubt.

Then turn toward the sacred shrines and exalted stations, and when thou hast recognized and found and attained their presence, pause and say:

May the first light that shone from the horizon of the face of your Lord, the Creator of heaven, be upon you, O manifestations of faithfulness and dawning-places of the names in the kingdom of creation! I testify that through you were raised the banners of victory and the standards of guidance, the horizon of steadfastness was illumined and the breeze of God wafted among all creatures. Through you was renewed the garment of martyrdom and there appeared that which bewildered minds and hearts. You are they who sacrificed what you possessed, your souls, every member of your bodies, and every vein in your flesh in the path of God, your Beloved and your Goal. You are they whom no oppressor’s tyranny, no censurer’s blame, nor the power of any who turned away from God deterred, when He came with sovereignty encompassing all in the heavens and earth. I testify that by your tribulation the Concourse on High lamented, and the dwellers of the Most Glorious Pavilion, and the tongue of God, the Protector, the Self-Subsisting, spoke forth. Before all believers: “We are God’s, and to Him shall we return.” And in all conditions, praise be to God, the Lord of what was and what shall be.

Thereafter, ask of God whatsoever thou desirest of His bounty. He is indeed the Mighty, the Loving.

He is the Most Holy, the Most Great.

O Friend! By the life of God, the episode of the sacrifice has recurred, and what lies hidden in God’s knowledge, the Lord of all worlds. The bird of fidelity has winged its flight from the branch of the world to the Divine Lote-Tree by reason of what the hands of the oppressors have wrought. We testify that he dwells in a joy unequaled by the joy of all creation, while his loved ones are in such grief that all things lament their condition. Thy Lord is, in truth, the All-Bountiful, the All-Knowing. By God! They have profited in their transaction while the oppressors are in manifest loss. Did Husayn lose when he offered up his spirit in the path of God, or did those who wronged him by following every remote transgressor? Oppression has reached such a point that the tongue is powerless to describe it, and beyond it lies all reckoning by any knowing one. They have kindled a fire whose flames shall not be quenched in the world. Thus does He inform thee, from Whose presence is the knowledge of all things in a Clear Book.

O Friend! Observe how manifest have become the truth of Truth and the misguidance of falsehood. All bear witness that from that Wronged One was manifested the utmost love, kindness and care toward all peoples, and no act that might cause mischief or corruption ever proceeded from Him. How many were the destitute strangers whom He assisted in times of hardship. To this testifies every truthful one, and beyond him thy Lord, the All-Informed. Should anyone reflect upon him and what appeared from him of the favors of his Lord, he would observe with the eye of certainty that in what transpired there was and shall be a great wisdom. The Most Great Sacrifice and Supreme Offering have been manifested in this Mighty Cause. When they appeared in Iraq before the Presence, the utmost favor was shown them from the Source of Command, to such an extent that certain souls spoke in the wilderness of idle fancies. Then God, through His pervading might, exalted that Lote-Tree to a station none knows save His All-Knowing Self, and sent down upon him blessings and mercy from His presence. He is, verily, the Almighty, the Powerful. Various writings from him were presented before the Throne, and he beseeched God, his Lord, the Master of the last and the first, to ordain for him the Most Great Martyrdom. By thy life, O Friend! Through his calamity all calamities were erased. To this thy Lord, the Wronged, the Stranger, bears witness. We have sent down for him from the heaven of grace that which equals not the kingdom of earth and heaven, and God shall soon cause to grow what He has planted in the soil of the Bayan. He is, verily, the Almighty Whom the hosts of the world and the ranks of the oppressors cannot withstand.

O Khalil! The divine Lote-Tree, which hath been planted by the hand of the Sovereign Will in the blessed and goodly soil, hath been watered by the blood of them that are sincere and monotheistic. Soon shall there become manifest in the earth, through the deeds of the oppressors, that which was destined. Doth the oppressor imagine that God is heedless of that which he hath wrought? Nay, by His Self, the One Who overshadoweth the worlds! By His truth, He shall assuredly manifest in the earth that which He hath revealed in the Book, as is clearly witnessed by him who possesseth insight from God, the Lord of the worlds. Observe the Suriy-i-Ra’is and other Tablets. By God’s life, thy heart and the hearts of them that are endued with understanding shall rejoice at that which hath been sent down therein. Were He to desire, He could seize all who are on earth through a single word from Him, yet He manifesteth His Cause through the wisdom that was hidden in His all-encompassing knowledge. I swear by the Sun of the horizon of power that were the world to possess any worth, the Ancient Beauty would not have dwelt for numbered years in the Most Great Prison. Man, so long as he is in this world, is in truth and ever shall be in the throes of death, save for those detached hearts that behold all things with the eye of God. God willing, your honor should, according to your capacity, instill tranquility and assurance in illumined hearts, that serenity might possess them after agitation, and joy after sorrow. Thus doth command thee He Who remembereth thee in this exalted station. O Khalil! A momentous affair hath occurred in the world, though greater than this hath been made manifest, as thou thyself dost witness and attest. However, as the Hand of Power had preserved it for a long time and then suddenly this irrevocable matter was revealed, it hath caused lamentation, weeping and trembling. Yet with thy Lord is that which shall gladden hearts after this great sorrow. Say: This is a testimony whose traces have penetrated the world; God shall soon reveal it in truth. He, verily, hath power over whatsoever He willeth. The glory be upon thee and upon those who have hearkened unto thy word concerning the Cause of God, the Lord of the Day of Judgment.

He is the One Who gazeth before His Face

O people of the cities and villages! Hearken unto that which the Tongue uttereth in the Kingdom of Utterance from One Who hath caused all things to speak that there is none other God but He, the Single, the All-Informed. He it is Who hath sent down the Books and dispatched the Messengers, that there is none other God but He, the All-Watching, the All-Wise. Every thing hath succeeded in hearkening to the Call save every aggressive sinner, and every eye hath beheld the horizon of God, the Most Glorious, save every heedless and remote one. By God! The Supreme Horizon hath appeared and the Sovereign of Destiny proclaimeth and saith:

O concourse of men! The Day is come and the moon is cleft asunder, and all are gathered to a new resurrection. The hidden is made manifest and the treasured is revealed, and the Promised One hath come from the heaven of destiny closer than the twinkling of an eye, yet the people are in evident delusion. They behold the sun, yet ask “Is this the sun?” They witness the signs, yet say “This is naught but mighty sorcery.” Thus hath the matter been decreed in the Book, while the people of the veil remain in strange doubt.

O loved ones of the All-Merciful in all lands! The Wronged One adjureth you by the Beloved of all possibility, Who speaketh in the kingdom of utterance, that ye be not unfaithful regarding people’s possessions. Be ye the trustees of God in His lands and the daysprings of truthfulness in His domains. Blessed is he who hath heeded God’s counsel and is of them that act.

Such treachery hath appeared in exile as hath melted My liver, caused Mine eyes to overflow, made My inner being lament, and constricted My breast. By God’s life! Sleep hath fled from the eyes of Baha by reason of what hath befallen Him in this white land. To this all things bear witness, yet the people are heedless. The rock hath cried out at My tribulation and the Divine Lote-Tree hath lamented My distress. By God! My sorrow is not for Myself but for the Cause of God, Lord of all worlds. All sorrows are for him who cannot recount what hath touched him of misfortunes and tribulations in this noble station.

We hear falsehood yet remain silent, while the liar supposeth the matter is confused, though We find him in manifest untruth. O My loved ones! Adorn yourselves with the attributes of God and array your temples in the raiment of trustworthiness, uprightness and truthfulness. Thus doth the Lord of creation command you in a preserved tablet.

Sorrows have increased at this time as We behold the embodiment of love and those with him under the claws of hatred from the hosts of the oppressors. Say: O God of Names and Creator of earth and heaven! We beseech Thee by this martyr who sacrificed himself in these days to manifest Thy Cause and exalt Thy Word, to send down upon Thy loved ones and chosen ones that which will preserve them from the claws of heedlessness and doubt. Then give them to drink, from the hand of Thy bounty, the Kawthar of certitude. Verily Thou art the Giver, the Bestower. There is no God but Thee, the All-Bountiful, the Most Generous.

He is the One Who remembereth in sorrow

O Land of Sad (Isfahan)! Remember what the people did to the family of the Messenger, and what befell the children of the Maiden from thy people. O Land of Sad! The Sun of Hijaz asketh thee about its family, and the Virgin Maiden about her sons and daughter. Did the oppressors cast her grave into the well of darkness, or did they drag her forth with ropes of hatred to another calamity? By the life of the Beloved! The powers of heaven were shaken by this calamitous catastrophe. Alas, alas! The Luminary of Batha lamenteth in the Most Exalted Concourse for what befell His family from the manifestations of hatred.

O people of Sad! By God, ye have committed that which hath bewildered the sources of vainglory and the daysprings of tyranny throughout all possibility. Judge fairly: by what proof did ye slay those through whom the Cause of the All-Merciful was spread in the East and West of the earth? Alas, alas! Through you was the Ark of the Messenger broken and the progeny of the Maiden drowned. Through you was joy transformed to sorrow, and darkness encompassed all in existence, save whom the All-Merciful willed.

O people of Sad! Hearken unto that which Muhammad, the Apostle of God, calleth out to you from the Most Sublime Horizon. O people of tyranny and wickedness! Where is Hasani, who was aflame with the fire of the love of God in the Kingdom of Creation, and was adorned with the ornament of faithfulness between earth and heaven? And where is Husayni, who accepted not ransom in the path of God, the Lord of all men? By My life, O company of evil ones, no excuse remaineth for you, nor room for any justification by saying “The righteous are God’s and the wicked are mine.” Do ye imagine yourselves to be believers, and do ye reckon yourselves among the people of the Furqan? Nay, by the Self of the All-Merciful! Every learned one who was adorned with the mantle of grace hath bewailed your deeds, and every man of wisdom who was invested with justice hath cried out because of your actions. The lamentation of the Concourse on High hath been raised by reason of your tyranny, and the cry of all things hath been lifted up because of that which your hands have wrought. Ye read the Qur’an, yet deny its Source and Him Who revealed it; ye acknowledge My Message, yet slay My sons and turn away from Him Who sent Me. O company of hatred, ye have bewildered Me, nay, all things created by the Word of God, the Sovereign, the Self-Subsisting! O Mariner of the Sea! Where are thy ships? Have they been shattered by the rocks of unbelief and dissension, or have they been drowned by the tempests of tyranny and hypocrisy? Have they sailed from the cities of bodies to the gardens of spirits, or have they migrated from the wilderness of separation and remoteness to the station of nearness and holiness and reunion? O Lord of the world! By Thy might and sovereignty, I am unable to mention that which hath befallen them from the winds of oppression. I myself am ashamed to recount what I have seen and known. Thou knowest what I know, and I know not what Thou knowest. Thou art, verily, the All-Knowing, the All-Wise. Yet I shall utter a word to manifest my submission to Thy binding Command and my obedience to Thy firm Decree: The Nightingale hath taken flight because the croaking of the raven hath been raised. The Command is God’s, the One, the All-Informed.

He is the Ruler in Truth and the Commander of Justice!

O My Name! Upon thee be My Glory! The letter from My Name Jamal, upon him be My Glory, was received and likewise heard. In truth, this world is not worthy nor capable of being the arena for the steed of the endeavors of God’s chosen ones. O Jamal! Consider thou the afflictions that have befallen this Wronged One, that what hath come upon thee may seem trivial in comparison. Look from what hath befallen thee to what hath befallen God. The carpet of this world is truly not worthy of joy and delight. Today, remembrance of God and attachment to Him was and is all that matters. Turn thy gaze from the deeds of men and fix it upon the deeds of God and what hath appeared from Him. These two days, the world of possibility was not and is not worthy of such mention and utterance.

In the prison of ?a, as all have heard and know, We were in fetters and chains for four months, and Our companions were mostly thieves and highwaymen. And as for food - bread that resembled that of the Sudanese people. By the life of God, in the early days, even that was not to be had! This Wronged One was brought bareheaded and barefoot in chains from Niyavaran to the prison of Tihran. That which is beyond human endurance was inflicted. Yet despite these afflictions which ye have seen, heard and know of, the tongue remained engaged in praise, the heart illumined with the greatest joy, and in prison this blessed verse was uttered: “He is sufficient unto me and sufficient unto all things. God sufficeth as protector.” All assured and tranquil souls uttered the same, and when their voices were raised, the prisoners would become bewildered and perplexed.

This Wronged One was repeatedly imprisoned, and all have heard of the afflictions that befell Us in the land of Mim. They paraded Us through the streets, and one day they delivered this Wronged One into the hands of the tyrannical divines. God alone knoweth what they did and said and what befell Us. For months they applied ointments and treated the wounds inflicted. Beyond all this, consider the oppression and tyranny of My brother and his followers. Wherever We went, before many days had passed, he would come and dwell in perfect comfort and honor with his known women companions - as all have heard and know - protected beneath the pavilions of protection. Yet they call him the wronged one and attribute injustice to God, exalted be His glory!

In brief, throughout all days We stood before the faces of the people and raised up the Cause of God to such a degree that both East and West of the earth heard and understood according to their capacity. Yet when the Sun of Glory dawned from the heaven of divine Will, they arose against its abasement and spoke such calumnies as had no like or equal, and not one soul among those heedless ones spoke with justice. Glory be to God! By order of the Sultan and the officials of the sublime state and Russia, We proceeded to Zawra. If this Wronged One was an oppressor, why did My brother proceed to that land and enter Our house? Furthermore, during the journey toward the Great City, he arrived in Mosul before Us and awaited Our arrival. Say: O people! Judge with fairness that which hath come to pass, that ye may distinguish the oppressor. I swear by the Sun of Proof which in this moment riseth from the horizon of the heaven of utterance! Mashriqu’l-Akhavi did not deem himself worthy of this station, but through the instigation of Siyyid Muhammad Isfahani and another soul, he chose this abasement for himself and for the Cause. The earth of God is vast and there are many other cities and regions - why this turning to the shadow of the Wronged One, and for what reason? Reflect, O people, and be of the fair-minded! A Tablet was sent in his name to the Most Holy and Exalted Presence of the Herald. By the life of God, that Holy One became so enkindled that mention of it transcends the realm of existence. Likewise were other Tablets sent, both to the Herald and to various regions. The utterance of this Wronged One stands forth among the words of the peoples like the sun, clear and manifest. Say: Return, that ye may know, and be not of the oppressors. In days when all were hidden in fear, this Wronged One appeared with utmost power and spoke with most eloquent utterance. Neither the arrows of destiny nor the swords of tribulation prevented Him. When the light of the Cause was raised up, there occurred what all have heard and seen. Through all conditions We have been thankful and content. O Jamal, upon thee be My glory! Erase the book of sorrows and with fresh clarity reflect on what hath been mentioned. He will open before thy face the gates of joy and gladness, of glory and delight. Verily thy Lord is powerful over whatsoever He willeth through His word “Be” and it is. Repeatedly hast thou mentioned the name of God, and He and all who circle round Him bear witness to God’s grace, bounty and kindness towards thee. Take the cup of joy from the hand of the bounty of My Most Glorious Name, then drink therefrom in spite of every caviling liar and every heedless doubter. The glory shining from the horizon of the heaven of My mercy be upon thee and upon those with thee and upon those who love thee and hearken to thy word concerning the Cause of God, the Lord of Lords.

In the Name of our Most Holy, Most Great, Most Exalted, Most Glorious Lord, He is God, exalted is He

Praise be to God Who is unique in His might, singular in His grandeur, and sanctified above the intimations of creation and the conditions of humanity - He through Whom one hears from the waves of the ocean of utterance that the All-Merciful hath come with power and sovereignty, and from the rushing of the winds of explanation that the Proof hath appeared and the Intended One hath come with a Cause that hath conquered all in the realm of possibilities. Exalted be His greatness and exalted be His dominion! The very essence of power hath confessed its powerlessness before the manifestations of His power, and the very essence of strength hath acknowledged its weakness before the evidences of His strength. He is the One of Whom all the books of the world have spoken, declaring that none can be described save through Him, and all the Messengers whom God hath sent unto the peoples have testified that none can be mentioned except by Him. He is the Single One Who cannot be known through singleness, and the Unique One Who cannot be described through uniqueness. He is a surging, wave-filled ocean wherein neither the ships of mystic knowledge, nor the vessels of utterance, nor the boats of remembrance can sail. Its waves arise not from winds but from a motion which none hath understood save Him. Verily He is the All-Knowing, verily He is the All-Informed. This is the motion that appeared from the stirring of the Primal Word - glorified be its Originator, its Speaker and its Manifestor. The servant testifieth in this station that the very essence of knowledge was ignorant of this atmosphere wherein no sound of the wings of the birds of utterance hath ever been heard. Verily He is the Almighty, the Powerful, the Bestower.

God willing, may they shine as the morning star from the horizon of divine love, brilliant and manifest. We have mentioned him in terms that nothing can equal, and through which his remembrance shall endure throughout the perpetuity of My mighty, exalted Kingdom. O servant, they have praised the Truth in most excellent utterance. God willing, may they ever be the recipients of God’s special favors.

This evanescent servant praises the Goal of all the world for that which the tongue of his nature hath spoken, which was acceptable before the Throne. Praise be unto Him, again praise be unto Him. All who circle round the Throne convey their greetings to his honor.

Regarding what was written about the quorum, whether permission is granted to the poor or not, when this was submitted, He said: We give you permission, but it is not generally permissible. Verily thy Lord is the All-Knowing, the All-Informed.

Furthermore, I presented mention of your honor to the most pure and luminous presence of the Divine Branches - may my spirit and being be sacrificed for the dust of their footsteps - and all of them, with utmost grace and kindness, conveyed their most glorious and resplendent greetings. Praise be to God, mention of your honor has been and continues to be made in the Most Holy Court and among others who circle round in this land. This evanescent servant requests that you convey expressions of his utter nothingness and evanescence to the Afnan who are present in that land, especially to those gentlemen who have returned from the Desired Land. In truth, whatever may be submitted, even if it were to fill numerous volumes, would be insufficient in view of this servant’s burning love. However, your honor knows that there is much work, especially in these days. I beseech God, exalted be His glory, that He may assist this evanescent one, despite his inability, weakness and nothingness, to accomplish this momentous task. Without God’s grace and His mercy and compassion, this servant has been and is as one non-existent, and has been and is as nothing.

He is God, exalted is He!

O spiritual beloved, that is, the sacred pillar of words and meanings, Aqa Husayn Aqa, upon him be 966 [the Glory of God] the Most Glorious!

Praise be to God that thou hast attained, and continuest to attain, to that which beseemeth His near and sincere servants, for thou art possessed of a noble character and an exalted station, and art nourished by food that hath not altered its taste. Blessed be ye and those who have attained to what ye have attained and are sustained as ye are sustained. And praise be to Him Who hath bestowed upon you and us the blessing of unity and guided us to His straight path.

Furthermore, should that beloved one send anything to the region of Syria, convey on behalf of this servant greetings, praise, remembrance and glory to my true brother and spiritual beloved, Aqa Muhammad-Rida, upon him be 966 [the Glory of God], and give him the glad-tidings of the Lord’s grace and favors. Praise be to God, mention is made of them, and their place and station in the Pillar and Station are evident and manifest. They have not been and are not absent for a moment, for from the right side of the heart, a firm place hath been assigned and established for them, and before the eye is their manifest station. How then could they vanish from sight?

In any case, the grape vines and trees they sent before and after arrived, and due to the abundance of rain and severity of winds, were placed in the soil. During these two or three days they were taken out and planting began in their name, as the true Planter and Cultivator. This year the intensity of rain disrupted the order and work of tree planting. Such is the decree of our Lord, the Mighty, the All-Knowing. For instance, the olive trees were cut two months from their location and it was not possible to place them in the ground due to the mud. In any case, now engaged in planting, we shall see what the grace of the true Cultivator and Director will bring to pass. As He, the Beloved One, hath said: He may cause it to grow or burn it. The command is in His hand and within His mighty grasp. He has expressed the desire for [fruit from] Qamsar. If those varieties can be found, there is no harm in the bitterness of their pits. The kind and variety should be good, delicious, fragrant and juicy. If with these qualities the pit is also sweet, that would be excellence upon excellence and light upon light. This servant was greatly saddened by the sent trees, for the giver had given whatever was in his garden out of love and affection, but the long duration [of the journey] and the strong eastern winds completely dried them on the way, to the extent that moisture was drawn from the very wood itself. Their restoration now lies with God, glorified be His majesty. He has given and gives life to decayed bones, but if at grafting time it becomes possible, let them send cuttings. It may be possible to graft them here onto apricot trees or others. Likewise, if the superior almond apricot becomes available - all matters depend upon the will and desire of the true Director and Creator. Whatever He ordains, the means for it have been and will be provided. Jinab-i-Aqa Muhammad-Rida himself has written that when fruits appear and ripen, they will send whatever fruit is good, desirable and considered among the pure things, in whatever way possible. This too depends on God’s will. In any case, write these matters to them or send this very paper to them. Perhaps this servant too will later be enabled to write a response. Verily God is the Confirmer, the Helper, the All-Knowing, the All-Wise. Peace be upon you and upon him and upon God’s righteous servants.

He is God, exalted be His station, His grandeur and His power!

Praise be to God, your well-being, patience, steadfastness, ecstasy, attraction and spiritual rapture have given rise to a joy and delight without parallel. The tongues of all those present, of the pilgrims and travelers, are engaged in offering praise and thanksgiving to that luminous point of the heart. This is a great bounty, a mighty feast and a momentous glad-tiding. This servant, clinging to the hem of His mercy and holding fast to the cord of His grace, beseecheth his Lord to open before your face the gates of all good things. Verily He is the Lord of creation, there is no God but Him, the One Who through His exalted Word hath power over all things, and He is the Commander of whatsoever He willeth and the Ruler in the beginning and in the end.

Each one is mentioned in the presence of the Wronged One. We beseech God to ordain for them that which will draw them nigh unto Him in all conditions. He, verily, is the Self-Sufficient, the Most Exalted.

In all conditions the honored Afnan, upon him be the Most Glorious Glory of God, is mentioned in the Presence and is the recipient of special favors. If the false claimants would not cause distress and would not commit that which grieveth him - I beseech Him to protect your honor from their evil and their schemes. Verily He witnesseth and seeth, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing. His Will hath prevailed over the wills of His creation, and His Purpose hath encompassed all who are in the heavens and on earth.

As for the matter of the tea, it arrived in accordance with the blessed letter and truly it was good and desirable and attained the honor of acceptance. For some time tea of such excellence had not been seen. At the time of its use, they mentioned concerning the honored Afnan of China, upon him be 966 [the Glory of God], that which the treasures of the world cannot equal. In truth, it is the Most Great Favor and the Supreme Grace - the confirmation of the Purpose of all worlds - that He hath aided him in a service whose reward and fruit are lasting and eternal, having no end. For from such matters as these the fragrance of love and devotion is diffused, and thus it was and is worthy of mention and fitting to be declared. His honor had also from the early days of the Cause turned towards it and attained the honor of the presence and meeting. They have acknowledged and confessed that which hath shone forth and risen from the horizon of God’s Will, the Lord of the worlds. This servant beseecheth his Lord to preserve his honor and aid them. Verily He is the Helper, the Almighty, the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.

I convey greetings to those present, especially to the honored Afnan and the son - upon them be the peace of God and His loving-kindness. For each one I seek the waters of the All-Merciful’s mercy and heavenly sustenance. Verily He fulfilleth the needs of all who ask. Glory and remembrance and praise be upon your honor and upon the son and upon those who love you and upon God’s unified servants. And praise be to God, the Lord of the worlds.

O My name Mahdi! Upon thee be My glory, My remembrance and My praise! Blessed art thou for having fulfilled My Covenant, spread My remembrance, arisen to extol Me and serve Me amongst My servants. We created all to attain Our presence, call upon Our Name and turn to Our Countenance. Yet some were deprived of My mercy, strayed from My path and failed to answer My call. Blessed is the distant one who remembers Me. By God, he is among those who stand upon My carpet and attain My presence. And among them is one who mentioned Me, whom We made one of the twigs of My Lote-Tree and leaves of My Tree.

Know then, O My servant who gazeth upon My face, that the servant hath attained the presence of his Sovereign and his letter was presented. When it was presented, the winds of My mercy were stirred and the ocean of My bounty surged. Thus did We cast upon the people of possibility the pearls of utterance through the grace of the All-Merciful. Blessed is he who attaineth unto them, recognizeth their value and preserveth them from those who are unworthy.

O Mahdi! Thy mention hath been made before the Countenance. We beseech God to assist thee in all conditions and to aid thee in the beginning and the end. Verily He is the Self-Sufficient, the Most Exalted.

Although restraint of the Pen is necessary due to the heedlessness of the nations, for the protection of God’s loved ones, yet through His grace, from the Fountainhead of His Will, the pure Water floweth according to measure. Blessed is he who drinketh, detached from all the worlds.

Among the letters received was one from one of the Afnan, upon him be the Glory of God, to whom all things testify of his love for his Lord, the Mighty, the All-Knowing. We have sent through the Trustworthy One to him and those around him that which will gladden the eyes of the mystics and cause the hearts of those who have turned to God to soar.

Thus doth the Supreme Pen address him from the direction of the white dome of the Ultimate Tree: “O thou who bearest My Name! Blessed art thou for having inhaled the fragrance of My raiment, turned to My face, spoken My praise, sought My presence, taken refuge in My sovereignty, heard My call from My Kingdom, answered Me amongst My servants, and soared in the atmosphere of My love, circling round My will. All this is from My confirmations, My care, My grace, My generosity and My mercy.

Blessed is he who turneth unto thee, heareth from thee the mention of thy Lord, and boweth before thee purely for My sake, hoping for My loving-kindness which We have sent down in the scrolls of My power and the tablets of My favor.

We have learned of the calamity that befell you, whereat tears flowed and sighs ascended to God, the Lord of Names and Attributes. By My life! In this ye have followed your Lord. We sacrificed one of the Branches for the exaltation of the Cause of your Lord, the All-Merciful. At the time they were washing him, My tongue was speaking between earth and heaven in remembrance of your Lord, the Most High, and My pen was flowing with that which caused the breezes of the All-Merciful to waft among all possibility. We have sent it to you. Blessed is he who considereth it and reflecteth upon that which hath appeared from the Command of his Lord, the Exalted, the Mighty, the Powerful, the Omnipotent.

Say to his relatives: Grieve not for him. He is with Us and will continue soaring in the atmosphere of the mercy of his Lord, the Forgiving, the Merciful. Through his mention We have adorned the Tablets, for We found in his heart what We found only in a few numbered souls. Blessed is he, and his father, and those who are with him from among My Afnan. Soon We shall send down for each one that which is better for them than all that hath been created in the heavens and earth. Verily, he is alive in My horizon, for We recognized in him what none knoweth save your Lord, the All-Knowing, the All-Informed.

God willing, those related to the Blessed Tree should not be saddened by this new calamity. In truth, they have followed the example of the Truth, for in all days calamities descended like rain upon the Beauty of Divine Unity. Were the exalted stations specially reserved for that Bird of the heaven of divine love to be mentioned, all would raise their hands in supplication toward the Most Exalted Horizon. We beseech God to aid all to that which He loveth.

Verily, He is living in My horizon, for We have known from Him what none has discovered save your Lord, the All-Knowing, the All-Informed. God willing, the kindred of the Blessed Tree should not be sorrowful at this new tribulation. In truth, they have followed the path of God, for in all days tribulations have rained down like torrential showers upon the Countenance of the Divine Unity. Were mention to be made of the sublime stations reserved for that Bird of the heaven of divine love, all hands of supplication would be raised toward the Most Exalted Horizon. We beseech God to aid all to achieve that which He loves and with which He is well-pleased.

The mention of his honor Aqa Shaykh ?adiq, upon him be the Glory of God, which was in your letter, was made before the Divine Presence. Previously a wondrous and glorious Tablet was sent especially for him. Say: O ?adiq! Blessed art thou for having drunk the choice wine sealed from the hand of the mercy of thy Lord, the Mighty, the Self-Subsisting. Nothing hath prevented thee from the remembrance of thy Lord. By My life! This is a praiseworthy station. It behooveth thee today to arise and say: O people! Follow Him by Whose praise all things speak, and Whose proof hath encompassed both the unseen and the visible. Pass by with the fragrance of thy Lord’s raiment, the All-Merciful, amongst all who dwell within the realm of possibility, that hearts and minds may be set ablaze through thee. We have made mention of thee in numerous Tablets. Verily thy Lord is the Mighty, the Loving. Say: O people! Forsake the world, for your Lord, the Lord of all names, hath come. Do ye imagine it will profit you in aught? Nay, by My Name, through which all who have entered the garment of existence were stirred! It will profit you only for a limited number of days. Cast it behind you, turning to that which your Lord, the All-Merciful, hath desired on this Day wherein the Sun of Revelation hath shone forth and the stars have fallen. O ?adiq! We have sprinkled upon thee from the ocean of My mercy, lest sorrow overtake thee in the remembrance of thy Lord, the All-Merciful, and that thou mayest speak forth His Name with wisdom and utterance, that perchance the peoples of the worlds may abandon what they possess and hold fast to the cord of thy Lord, the Almighty, the Mighty, the Beloved. Rejoice thou in My remembrance of thee yet again, then inhale therefrom the fragrances of thy Lord’s raiment, the Knower of the unseen.

=== START BH01160 ===

He is God, the King, the All-Mighty, the Most Great, the Most Holy!

I call upon Thee now, O my God, at this time when the lamp of oneness is kindled in the niche of white light, and this eternal candle melts in the crimson lamp, and the heart is consumed by the fire of grief in the liver of Baha, and the cock of the Cause cries out in the most exalted Kingdom, and crimson tears flow upon sallow cheeks. For though he writes before Thee with the pen of ink upon the green tablet, yet in the secret of his heart he writes with the pen of blood upon pieces of his liver that which none can hear in the nearest dominion. Therefore have the breezes of the Spirit been cut off from the city of eternity, and the fruits have fallen from the Tree of Paradise, and the branches of the Lote-Tree of the uttermost boundary have been broken, and the melodies of the Dove have been stilled in the most exalted company, and the joy of the pure ones in the most glorious chambers has been transformed, inasmuch as I am surrounded by mountain scorpions and sea-dogs, such that were I to turn to the right, their venom would touch me, and were I to turn to the left, their dogs would wound me, and were I to raise my head, the millstone would descend upon it.

And matters have reached such a state that I am cut off from all the delights of earthly blessings, and if I desire to drink water, I drink from my heart’s blood, and if I wish to take food, I eat from a piece of my liver. All this, O my God, is from those things which have befallen me in Thy love and descended upon me in Thy service. Thou art now able to preserve me, so preserve me; and if Thou wilt not do this, then build for me a house near Thy mighty throne above the heavens of Thy eternal glory. Then raise me unto Thee that I may dwell therein through Thy grace and find rest in the vicinity of Thy mercy, for I find no place for myself in Thy earth whereon to set my foot or wherein to abide, for Thy servants hate me and banish me, and every day they conspire to slay me and say concerning me what they please and judge me as they desire, such that I have become bewildered in my affairs and find neither refuge to flee to, nor place to settle in, nor sanctuary wherein to dwell to serve those who love Thee and to be a helper to Thy Cause and a guardian of Thy decree, until I may attain martyrdom in Thy path before Thee, for in Thy hands is the kingdom of all things and Thou art powerful over all things. Then I beseech Thee, O my God, by the sorrow that hath afflicted me in Thy path and which hath never left me for a moment, that Thou mayest cause me to ascend unto the paradise of Thine eternity and raise me up unto it through Thy bounty, and deprive me not of that which hath been ordained therein of the wondrous gifts of Thy oneness and the gems of the favors of Thy divine unity, that I may be of them that dwell therein and journey in the precincts of its mercy, lest the whisperings of Satan prevent me from my love for Thee, my yearning toward Thee, my passion for Thee and my ardor for Thee. For verily it is a paradise created from the essence of Thy power and fashioned from the subtleties of Thy might, wherein the sun shineth unclouded, and its moon is radiant without eclipse, and its stars never fall, and its mansions never crumble, and its trees never change, and its fruits never alter, and its mysteries are never veiled, and its breezes never cease, and its treasures never perish, and its light is never extinguished, and its garment never wears out, and its verses are never abrogated, and its clusters are near at hand, and its fruits endure, and its leaves are evergreen, and its blessings are perfect. Its sun hath ever been at its zenith and its moon at the height of beauty. Glorified art Thou, glorified art Thou, O my God! By Thy might, were I to attempt to describe, throughout the duration of Thy sovereign might and the continuance of Thy pure power, even a drop of what Thou hast created therein of the manifestations of Thy creative act and the holy expressions of Thy divinity, I would be utterly powerless, enfeebled and at a loss, ere I could utter a single letter of the essence of that which Thou hast created therein by Thy power and brought into being by Thy will. Glorified art Thou, glorified art Thou! Unto One like Thee befitteth the mantle of grandeur and glory and the gems of might and power, for verily Thou art the True Powerful One, and we are all Thy servants and unto Thee do we return.

=== START BH01161 ===

In the Name of God, the All-Seeing, the One!

Sanctified and holy has been and shall ever be the Sovereign Who illumined the horizon of the world with the lights of the Most Great Luminary and adorned all things with the ornament of His names. He is the true Sovereign Whose Word has dominated all things and Whose Will encompasses the heavens and earth. By His soul-stirring call He manifested absolute nothingness in the garment of being, and through the revelations of the Most Exalted Pen He adorned the kingdom of creation. He is the Quickener of the world, the Illuminator of the world, the Renewer of the world, and the Speaker of the world. Every exalted one has been and shall be lowly before the manifestations of His exaltation, and every lofty one has been and shall be abased before the evidences of His transcendence. The tongue, which is the seat of His mention, is His creation, and by the Word of that Sovereign of the unseen and the seen have all things come from utter nothingness into the realm of being. And the heart, which is the dwelling-place of His knowledge, has come into existence through His Will. Glorified is the Creator above the mention of the created, and glorified is the Lord above the mention of all created things, and glorified is the Beloved above the descriptions of hearts. All the mystics, divines, chosen ones and holy ones are powerless and incapable of comprehending a single word of the Most Exalted Word which has been revealed through the Will of the Sovereign of Names from the Most Exalted Pen–how much less can they comprehend the Manifestation of the Word, the Sovereign of the Word, the Source of the Word, the Promoter of the Word, the Quickener of the Word, and the Mover of the Word. This blessed Word, in one station, is known and mentioned by all names and attributes, and when it appeared, it bowed down and prostrated itself and spoke, saying: “Praise be unto Thee, O Thou Who hast revealed Thy countenance from the horizon of the heaven of Thy Will! I testify that Thou art the Almighty, the All-Compelling, the Self-Subsisting.” All the signs of the Hour and the Resurrection are manifested through Him and established in Him. He is the Breath of God through Whose wafting and fragrances prepared souls have awakened from the sleep of heedlessness and perceived the Day of God. He is the Water of Life through Whose bounty dead bodies have attained unto eternal life. Should this evanescent servant attempt to expound this station, he would surely find himself powerless; nay, he would behold all existence bewildered in this most exalted station. And were a drop from the ocean of the knowledge of this station to be granted, in view of the supreme wisdom that has been revealed from the Most Exalted Pen and which all have been commanded to observe, there would be no power to make mention thereof save by the command of Him Who is with Him. Verily, He is the Commander, the All-Knowing, the All-Compelling, the Almighty, the Most Powerful, the All-Informed. How excellent is the state of the soul that hath inhaled the fragrance of the days of God and stood firm and steadfast in His love. This station is indeed most great, and its greatness is such that the Pen of the world is powerless and incapable of describing it, for this is the Day concerning which all divine Books bear witness and of which all the Prophets have given tidings. By God, the Truth! This is a Day wherein souls have trembled and eyes have been blinded, a Day wherein God hath come in the shadows of light, a Day wherein mankind hath stood before God, the Lord of the visible and the invisible. Blessed is he who hath attained, and woe unto the heedless. And praise be to God, the Lord of the worlds.

Glorified art Thou, O my God, Lord of the Kingdom and the angelic realm, Creator of the celestial dominion! Thou knowest that this humble one desired that his call be honored by the hearing of my beloved among Thy chosen ones, whom Thou hast chosen for Thy love, established for Thy service, created to hearken unto Thy call, aided to turn toward the horizon of Thy grace, honored with the living waters from the cup of Thy bounty, and made to recognize Thy Day which most of Thy creation hath neglected. Then Thou didst cause him to utter the testimony which Thou hast placed above the kingdom of utterance and of which the understanding of Thy creatures fell short. All this is from Thy grace, Thy generosity, Thy bounty and Thy benevolence. I thank Thee for this through the perpetuity of Thy names and attributes and through the permanence of Thy Most Exalted Word amongst Thy creation. I beseech Thee to protect him in all conditions through Thy power and sovereignty. Verily, Thou art powerful over whatsoever Thou willest. There is no God but Thee, the Protector, the Self-Subsisting.

My heart, my joy and my soul be a sacrifice for your love! The servant hath attained to hearing the melodies of the nightingales of your praise upon the branches of the Lote-Tree of utterance, and hath been honored by that which flowed from your pen whereby your mention appeared and the sun of your love shone forth from the horizon of certitude. We beseech God to grant me success in hearkening unto your sweetest mention at all times. Verily, He is the Powerful, the All-Bountiful, the Mighty, the Inaccessible.

If you inquire about the conditions of this land, praise be to God, all are safe and speaking in remembrance of God. However, due to the war that has occurred, the people of these regions are in distress and afflicted with utmost hardship. All ears are heedless of the call of the muezzin, and hearts are empty of the knowledge and love of Truth. In brief, a great calamity hath encompassed the people. This is what the All-Merciful promised in the Tablets.

To his honor Aqa Mirza ’Abdu’l-?amid, upon him be the Glory of God, I convey most sublime, most impregnable, most exalted greetings. God willing, may he ever remain and continue to be enkindled with the fire of the love of God and speaking in His remembrance. The circumambulators of the Throne all convey their pure devotion to his honor.

In the month of Mu?arram 1295

=== START BH01162 ===

He is God, exalted be His glory, the Greatness and the Power!

Praise be befitting and worthy of the Beloved of the world and the Goal of all peoples, Who hath adorned the realm of existence with the ornament of knowledge. He is the Omnipotent One Who bestowed existence upon utter nothingness and commanded the worship of His peerless Being. He is the Sovereign Who hath ever loved and will ever love His knowledge; therefore He brought creation from non-existence into being. And His knowledge is not realized except through knowledge of the Dayspring of Revelation, the Dawning-Place of His Manifestation, the Source of His Cause, and the Manifestation of His Self, through Whom appeared His power, His might, His grace, His sovereignty, His greatness, His loftiness and His authority. Exalted be His station and His glory! Through Him He revealed His signs and His evidences, and made Him the Lord of His Messengers and the Seal of His Prophets. Upon Him and upon His family and His companions be His blessings, His peace, His glory, His mercy and His favors. We beseech God through them to assist through them the people of divine unity to return unto Him, to turn in repentance at the gate of His grace, and to hold fast to His cord, that there may be revealed that which was concealed and raised up that which was cast down.

Glory be unto Thee, O God of kings and Master of all who are owned! I beseech Thee to enable the people of the white path to return unto Thee, then open before their faces the gates of Thy glory, Thy mercy and Thy favors. O my Lord! Thou seest them in the hands of the idolaters among Thy servants, where the people of hatred have surrounded them from all sides and have seized their cities and homes through oppression, for which those who acknowledge Thy unity and confess Thy oneness have lamented. O Lord! Do Thou absolve us of our transgressions which have stripped us of the garments of glory and honor. Verily Thou art the Lord of all creation. There is none other God but Thee, the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.

Thereafter, thy distinguished letter shone forth like the morning star and brought joy. Praise be to God, each letter thereof was a gate of gladness, for from it wafted the fragrance of the love of the Beloved of the worlds. Blessed art thou and those with thee. After its presentation before Him, the Lord–may our spirits be a sacrifice for Him–said: “O thou who gazest toward the horizon! Thy letter hath come and he who was present before the Wronged One read it. We heard and have answered thee with that which will gladden thy heart and solace thine eyes. We beseech God, exalted be He, to grant thee every good that hath been sent down in His Book and to ordain for thee from His Most Exalted Pen the good of the hereafter and of this world. Verily, He is powerful over all things.” Thou hast ever been mentioned in the presence of the Wronged One. Thou art among those souls whom God hath assisted and granted that which is the cause and source of the joy of the hearts of those near unto Him. The fragrance of thy sincerity is diffused throughout the world, and from all regions have come noble and wondrous accounts of thy character and deeds. Every soul who hath visited that land hath mentioned and continueth to mention thy good name. In truth, service to the Cause consisteth in such deeds and character as cause the spread of the traces of the friends of God. Blessed are ye and joy be unto you! Praise be to God that ye have attained unto that which shall endure and persist. We send greetings to all the friends in that land and we beseech for each one that which is the cause and source of exaltation, ascendancy and elevation. Verily He is the Hearer, the Answerer, and He is the Compassionate, the Generous.” End.

Praise be to God! The generosity, compassion and mercy of the True One, glorified be His majesty, has encompassed and continues to encompass all. We were non-existent and He brought us into being; we were silent and He bestowed upon us the power of utterance; and He taught and made us aware of the ultimate purpose through words and meanings. Exalted be His power and His sovereignty! This servant testifies with both outer and inner tongue that had the people of the resplendent Faith acted according to the radiant Law and held fast to the divine Book, none would have prevailed over them and no cities or lands would have been plundered. Until now they are observed to be sleeping, for they have not arisen to redress what has been lost. In any case, we beseech God for His confirmation, that perchance the dispirited may become enkindled and the wayward may find the path. The command is in His hands; He doeth whatsoever He willeth and ordaineth whatsoever He desireth. He is the Almighty, the All-Powerful.

As to what was written concerning the House, after submission they stated that whatever belongs to you should revert to the Truth. At present in that land there is no one who can attend to affairs and act as is befitting. Therefore if someone is found who can repair it and dwell therein, this would be acceptable; otherwise, it would be preferable to sell it.

Regarding what you wrote about the intention of Aqa Muhammad-Kazim, upon him be God’s favor, according to His command if it can be accomplished with wisdom–that is, if the non-believers of that land do not become aware of his coming–there is no objection to his proceeding. I convey greetings and praise to each of the friends in that land, and I beseech the True One, glorified be His majesty, that they may ascend to greater heights and loftiness each day, nay each moment. Indeed, the mention of Alexandria has become the cause and source of joy to the friends in all regions. The servant beseeches confirmation and aid for them. Verily, He is the Hearer, the Answerer. Peace and praise be upon you and upon God’s righteous and sincere servants.

The Servant

5 Ramadan 1303

This is a Book for him who should glory among the worlds, for God hath related him unto Himself and named him ’Abdu’l-Husayn. He is the Mighty, the Most Wondrous, the Most Glorious.

The remembrance of God from the Lote-Tree of Eternity in the Paradise of the Command hath been raised in the most wondrous melodies. Hearken, O people, unto that which is revealed unto you from the direction of the Spirit, and follow not every rejected idolater. Say: The Ancient Beauty hath appeared with the Most Great Glory, and the Spirit of Holiness hath warbled in the chambers of intimacy, “Blessed be God for this bounty that hath encompassed the worlds.” Say: The Ultimate Lote-Tree hath borne wondrous holy fruits. Deprive not yourselves thereof, O people, and follow not every sinful deceiver. Say: O concourse of the heavens and earth, await ye the Day wherein the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give its light, and the stars shall fall, and clamor shall arise from every ignorant one and learned one, and God shall come with hosts of angels, with the dominion of Command on His right hand and the Kingdom of Power mightily on His left.

Say: We have indeed raised that Day even now, and the Ancient Beauty hath come upon clouds of glory with a sovereignty that hath encompassed the worlds, with the dominion of grace on His right hand and the Kingdom of Names on His left. Thus have We raised that Day with mighty sovereignty. Say: O people, abandon what ye possess, then take what hath been sent down from One mighty and all-knowing. Say: When the days were the days of tyranny, We deposited a handful of clay behind the veil, and We made allusion to it as a wisdom from Us, and thus was the matter truly decreed. And We returned all names unto it through Our power and might, in glorification of My Self, Who hath power over all things.

Place it upon thy head, then inhale its fragrance that thou mayest discover therein the sweet savors of thy Lord and be drawn to His holy and faithful seat. O servant! Stand firm in the Cause, then open thy tongue in remembrance of thy Lord and fear no one, for verily He will guard thee in truth, even as He hath protected thee in many situations. Rejoice in thy soul and be gladdened in thy being, for God hath aided thee to recognize the Manifestation of His Self and hath given thee to drink from the fingers of grace a pure draught. Be united with Our Most Great Name in the Cause, for verily We have made it a shining lamp for you. Be unified in God’s Cause and His religion in such wise that no differences may arise among you - this is a matter We have loved from all eternity and have inscribed in preserved tablets of glory. Soon will Satan come unto you with that which will prevent you from the love of God and His Cause. Leave him then and what he hath behind you, and turn your faces toward the holy seat of the Beloved. Stand so firmly in the Cause that even should all who are in the heavens and earth contend with thee, and should there remain on earth no believer but thee, thou wouldst yet arise by thyself in the Cause. This is God’s command upon thee, and verily His command hath ever encompassed all worlds. Board the crimson ark in My Most Great and Most Exalted Name, then sail upon the ocean of grandeur that thou mayest be recorded among the people of Baha in the Mother Book. Leave the idolaters and what they possess, and take the Book of God with power from Us and strength from Our presence, then read it morn and eve. And glory be upon the people of Baha from One mighty and beautiful.
